OK

Measurements

Downloads the measurements.zip file needed for REW. If you already got your measurements (.mdat) file saved in REW you can skip this

If you plan to use the same measurements simply save them all in REW

Each run after this one simply load the .mdat file that will contain all your measurements, this way you do not have to download the zip anymore

OK

Advanced options

Select this option to enable the Advanced options, be careful don't enable this if you don't know what you're doing.

OK

Set end frequency

Schroeder frequency. Set to Calculate to get closer calculations based on your room dimensions

If set to Calculate "Advanced options" needs to be enabled, to enable the room dimension calculator

OK

Force THX Crossover

Sets the THX standard for crossovers

Select this option to set the THX standard crossover (Recommended for 90/95% of the home users!)

CENTER, LEFT, RIGHT, SURROUND, SURROUND REAR, SURROUND REAR SINGLE will be crossed over at 80Hz

FRONT HEIGHT, SURROUND HEIGHT, REAR HEIGHT, TOP FRONT, TOP MIDDLE, TOP REAR will be crossed over at 120Hz

FRONT DOLBY (Bounce), SURROUND DOLBY (Bounce), REAR DOBLY (Bounce) will be crossed over at 150Hz

OK

Align sub to centre speaker

Align sub to centre speaker > Subwoofer(s) will be time aligned to the 'Centre' speaker, front speakers will be set to 'Large', 'Subwoofer Mode' will need to be set to 'LFE' in the receiver.

NOT RECOMMENDED

OK

Force Large Fronts

When selected, front speakers will be set forced to 'Large / Full range'.

NOT RECOMMENDED

* unlike what the name suggest, this has nothing todo with the physical appearance of your speaker(s)

* should be left / set to small for 95% of all users.

OK

Force Large Center

When selected, Center speaker will be set forced to 'Large / Full range'.

NOT RECOMMENDED

* unlike what the name suggest, this has nothing todo with the physical appearance of your speaker(s)

* should be left / set to small for 95% of all users.

OK

Force Large Surround(s)

When selected, Surround speakers will be set forced to 'Large / Full range'.

NOT RECOMMENDED

* unlike what the name suggest, this has nothing todo with the physical appearance of your speaker(s)

* should be left / set to small for 95% of all users.

OK

Force Large Rear/Back Surround(s)

When selected, Surround Rear/Back speakers will be set forced to 'Large / Full range'.

NOT RECOMMENDED

* unlike what the name suggest, this has nothing todo with the physical appearance of your speaker(s)

* should be left / set to small for 95% of all users.

OK

Avoid sub polarity inversion

Avoids subwoofer polarity inversion checks in optimizations. Select this option if your sub(s) don't have a polarity/phase inversion flip switch.

NOT RECOMMENDED

> should be set right during initial measurements in Audyssey

OK

Force! Avoid sub polarity inversion

If the script stops with:

[ERROR!] Optimization cannot continue!

[IMPORTANT!] Please identify the reason and fix excessive delays in one or more of your subs then repeat Audyssey calibration!

It should force a less optimal alignment

OK

Center level adjustment

Allows +dB gain for the Center level

If you need extra volume on your center

This way you don't have to adjust it manually in the app

OK

Cap subwoofer LPF frequency

Limits lowpass filter evaluation frequencies for even number of sub(s) (odd number of sub(s) are automatically limited) to avoid bass localization in 'LFE + Main' mode.

NOT RECOMMENDED

> 'LFE + Main' should be avoided for most people.

OK

Force 1st mic position @ RLP

Only first microphone position measurements will be used in calculations rather than average of all measured mic positions. May yield better results in certain room conditions.

NOT RECOMMENDED

> Only recommended for users that have a dedicated theather room and want their RLP to be leading

> Should not be used when you enjoy watching movies on the couch with family and friends

OK

Measurements with DEQ enabled

It is highly recommended to take your measurements at the reference level of 75db (for home theatre).

NOT RECOMMENDED

> It's not recommended to take measurements below reference level

OK

Change MaxBoost

MaxBoost. Will allow a boost of up to (chosen value dB) to be able to reach the target curve

If it does not reach the target curve (with the chosen MaxBoost) it will not boost at that frequency.

OK

Change OverallMaxBoost

OverallMaxBoost. Will allow a boost of up to (chosen value dB) to the overal SPL (Sound Pressure Level) of a given speaker

Applied after all Equalizing is done (or not?).

OK

Change Reference Level

Reference Level. Will allow you to change the reference level

This will align each speaker's volume to precisely (chosen value)dB at the listening position...

Default is 75db (Audyssey default)

OK

REW Version

REW Version. An out of date REW beta version has been detected

Please download the latest version here

OK

Set Filter range start (filter)

Filter/startFrequency. Set the "startFrequency" where the script should start to do it's work

This can be set per speaker(pair) for more control

OK

Set Curve Merge end

Merge/Frequency. Set the "Merge" up to where the Target Curves should be merged

Recommended: 272 for Speakers

Recommended: 250 for Subwoofer(s)

OK

Debug mode

Debug mode. Get your logfile spammed with useless information

For those who like endless log spam

OK

Set Crossover(XO) type

Choose between single or ranged. Set the type of Crossover to use.

This can be set per speaker(pair) for more control

OK
  1. Download and install the free room correction software Room EQ Wizard (v5.40 Beta - or higher) on your computer
    • Download link for the latest REW Beta version: here
  2. Once you have downloaded and installed Room EQ Wizard start it (the button below should be green)
  3. If the below button is red or orange, click it to re-check the REW status
  4. REW API - server is down!

REW SETTINGS:

  1. Max rew measurements:
  2. Max rew measurements:
  3. Default target curve:
  1. Click the 'Upload calibration' button below to browse to the Audyssey calibration file (.ady) generated by the MultEQ Editor (IOS/Android) app
  1. Open the zip file and select ALL (keyboard shortcut: "CTRL+A" for Windows / "Command+A" for Mac) the files in that folder
  2. Left click on the selection and drag & drop them onto REW. Wait until all measurements are imported and 'Optimize calibration' button is enabled
  3. In REW left column you should be seeing your Audyssey speaker measurements with increasing index numbers sorted in alphabetical order
  4. Keep REW at "SPL & Phase" tab and close all REW child windows during the optimization process for a robust experience
  5. If you intend to run optimization multiple times with the same calibration: 'Save all', 'Remove all' and 'Open' saved measurements before each run
  • Waiting for .ady upload

  1. Be sure to set the same target levels that you will be using with Nvexx ClariQ
  2. Set reference level for speakers to @ Set the reference level for your speakers. Some might call it "Speaker target fill".
  3. Set reference level for subwoofer(s) to @ Set reference level for your Subwoofer(s). Some might call it "Subwoofer target fill".
  4. Starting process set reference levels
  1. If you are not sure about the "Reference level(s)" according to the Curve being used, please use the helper below!
  1. Select the type of seating arrangement to calibrate for
  2. Use the selection options below to select the arrangement that is most appropriate for your listening area
  3. No one can tell you what type to use and what will work best for your setup
    • Be sure to experiment by calibrating for more than one arrangement and auditioning the results

Tight focused imaging

This arrangement is best for a single listener.

Focused imaging

This arrangement is optimized for a single listener but also caters for additional listeners

Wide imaging (Default)

This arrangement is optimized for multiple listeners.
  1. Please set the full file paths for your curves below
  2. You only have to do this once, the paths will be saved
  1. Flat Curve - please use the Nvexx_FlatCurve here (75dB flat baseline curve - placeholder)
  1. Speaker Curve - please select the curve you want to use for your Speakers (Nvexx_AvgCurve - recommended)
  1. Subwoofer Curve - please select the curve you want to use for your Subwoofer(s) (Nvexx_BoostCurve - recommended)
  1. Please enter the same End Frequency for all your Speakers that you will use with the Nvexx Audyssey optimisation Tool!
  2. This will be the 'merge' Frequency where the Curve will blend with the speaker created curves (True Target)
  3. select the group on the right side to set the options for each speaker/(pair)
